column4: I'm trying to install GNUstep Position http://www.gnustep.it/enrico/position/  When I run "make install" I get this error. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/10368 Can someone give me some insight into what I am doing wrong??
I prefer the default GAIM in Ubuntu
is there a readme file?  you probably have to run ./configure first or "make" first , before you make install
there's a README in the PROJ.4 subdirectory
hmm actually that's just the projection sw, the Project makefile is referencing files that don't exist.  that's why you're getitng those errors.
i think you need to apt-get install gnustep-make
if you have those files it's yelling about you probably just need to set the GNUSTEP_MAKEFILES environment var to point to the directory they're in.
do   export GNUSTEP_MAKEFILES=/path/to/the/files   then try the make install
i've never used gps on any os :]
yeah that's different- now you're getting build errors, congratulations :]
that seems to be an objective C something or other... you prolly need objc libs & stuff.

see now it's getting difficult.  you set up the build environment (installed gnumake, pointed at the makefile directory, installed objc compiler) but these are either coding errors or libary version mismatch problems or something...   i don't know how to help you further.
check the mailing list or contact the author of the program :]
